Class JFreeChartBlock

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.fblock.Entity

          net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock.JFreeChartBlock
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface, ReportImageInterface, SubscriberCallback
public class JFreeChartBlock
extends FunctionBlock
implements ReportImageInterface

Uses JFreeChart library to plot measurements..

See Also:

Method Detail

configure

public void configure(ArgArray conf)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationInterface
Provides a method to configure object properties. The registry argument contains an ArgArray composed named values. Any values that are not specified are assumed to be left unchanged. That is, if a value is not present, do not assume it means 0 or true or some other default. This allows the configure method to be used to set a single value without affecting other values.

Specified by:
configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
Overrides:
configure in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
conf - contains incoming configuration parameters as named values.

Name Default Description
FunctionBlock.pubPorts null This section is where the publication topics for the Function Block is specified. There should be an ArgArray named 'result' contained within this section, containing an Argument named 'topic' for each topic that the block is subscribed to. Here is an example: storeMeasurement triggerAlarm

In this example, the block publishes on two topics: storeMeasurement and triggerAlarm.
FunctionBlock.subPorts null This section is where the sybscription topics for the Function Block is specified. There should be an ArgArray named 'trigger' contained within this section, containing an Argument named 'qual' for each topic that the block is subscribed to. Here is an example which defines a "trigger" port that subscribes to the topics "triggerAlarm" and "storeMeasurement": storeMeasurement triggerAlarm

In this example, the block subscribes on two subscription qualifiers: storeMeasurement and triggerAlarm.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)
